intro: Hoffmannia guerrerensis, commonly known as the Guerrerensis Hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to warm, arid climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
